#summary designing your own custom.cfg feed parsing config

= Introduction =

CIF comes with a variety of pre-built feed configurations, with that there are ways to create your own configs for various custom feeds.

= Details =
== Common Parameters ==
|| Parameter Name || Values || Description ||
|| feed || <uri><filename> || path to the feed ||
|| source || <FQDN> || source of the feed, usually the domain where the feed is from (eg: example.com) ||
|| impact || <string> || see TaxonomyImpact ||
|| description || <string> || short (1-2 space delimited word) description of the activity (eg: tdss spyeye) ||
|| severity || <string> || see TaxonomySeverity ||
|| confidence || <int> || see TaxonomyConfidence ||
|| guid || <string> || default: 'everyone' unless you know what you're doing ||
|| restriction || <string> || public, default, need-to-know, private ||
|| alternativeid || <string> || usually a url pointing to the original data point (as a reference id) ||
|| alternativeid_restriction || <string> || public, default, need-to-know,private || 
|| detection || <string> || hourly/daily: what to "fuzz" the detection string to ||
|| period || <string> || hourly/daily: how often the cif_crontool should pick up this feed (when in doubt, use daily) ||
